column4: Can somebody please help me to get my ATI card to work with ubuntu? Tried the wiki article that ubotu said, but it doesn't work. I have no gui so it's hard to get help for myself on google etc.
how far u get?
using apt-get?
a good place to start is /var/log/Xorg.0.log
should I pastebin xorg.0.log?
well, I am in text-only too.  but yes, you should anyway, I can always start GDM back up
you can use grep to filter the output of the log file.  Try it with (EE) for error lines, or WW for warning.
Hey, go on and pastebin your Xorg.0.log AND your /etc/X11/xorg.conf files since I'm going graphical here anyway
I have a driver cd should I use that? But is it only for windows that I can use it?
scratch that, now i cant start GDM cuz of my broken upgrade. (sigh)
so will my drivers cd do any good?
you should first be trying the ubuntu package for the ATI binary drivers.  It is called xorg-driver-fglrx and is avialable in apt or Synaptic program on administrative menu.
NOT sure if you need to activate the universe or multiverse repositories, though.
you might.
you already have xorg-driver-fglrx installed via Ubuntu package management system (apt/synaptic)
Okay then.  Well, you may have used it to start the install
There is after all the foss 'ati' driver, xorg-driver-ati that does not have all the hardware acceleration but gives  u x
but you can get the fglrx to work.  i have a radeon 9800 xt working fine on Breezy
fglrxinfo yields an error
have you tried grepping the x log for errors yet?
try something like "cat /var/log/Xorg.0.log|grep EE" or try with WW for warning lines.  If too much for a screen (doubtful), you can also pipe to more by adding "|more"
sudo /etc/init.d/gdm restart
any luck?
